yaml.title: Adjust HomeKit Options
yaml.description: This entry is controlled via YAML

init.description: HomeKit can be configured expose a bridge or a single accessory. In accessory mode, only a single entity can be used. Accessory mode is required for media players with the TV or RECEIVER device class to function properly. Entities in the “Domains to include” will be included to HomeKit. You will be able to select which entities to include or exclude from this list on the next screen.
init.title: Select mode and domains.

accessory.title: Select the entity for the accessory

include.description: Select entities from each domain in “{domains}”. The include will cover the entire domain if you do not select any entities for a given domain.
include.title: Select the entities to be included

exclude.description: All “{domains}” entities will be included except for the excluded entities and categorized entities.
exclude.title: Select the entities to be excluded

data.camera_copy: Cameras that support native H.264 streams

cameras.description: Check all cameras that support native H.264 streams. If the camera does not output a H.264 stream, the system will transcode the video to H.264 for HomeKit. Transcoding requires a performant CPU and is unlikely to work on single board computers.
cameras.title: Camera Configuration

advanced.description: Programmable switches are created for each selected device. When a device trigger fires, HomeKit can be configured to run an automation or scene.
advanced.title: Advanced Configuration

user.description: Choose the domains to be included. All supported entities in the domain will be included except for categorized entities. A separate HomeKit instance in accessory mode will be created for each tv/receiver media player, activity based remote, lock, and camera.
user.title: Select domains to be included

pairing.title: Pair HomeKit
pairing.description: To complete pairing follow the instructions in “Notifications” under “HomeKit Pairing”.

abort.port_name_in_use: An accessory or bridge with the same name or port is already configured.

unpair.name: Unpair an accessory or bridge
unpair.description: Forcefully removes all pairings from an accessory to allow re-pairing. Use this service if the accessory is no longer responsive, and you want to avoid deleting and re-adding the entry. Room locations, and accessory preferences will be lost.
